perturbation.original_text: A. CONSULTANT'S "ENDORSEMENT" means the right to use the CONSULTANT'S name, fame, nickname, autograph, voice, facsimile, signature, photograph, likeness, and image in connection with the marketing, advertising, promotion and sale of ADAMS GOLF'S PRODUCT.
perturbation.changed_text: A. CONSULTANT'S "ENDORSEMENT" means the right to use the CONSULTANT'S name, fame, nickname, autograph, voice, facsimile, signature, photograph, likeness, and image in connection with the marketing, advertising, promotion and sale of ADAMS GOLF'S PRODUCT. However, Adams Golf may only use Consultant's likeness for internal marketing material.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants rights to use the consultant's likeness for marketing, advertising, promotion, and sale of products. The modified text restricts likeness usage to internal marketing materials only. This creates a contradiction because 'endorsement' typically includes public-facing advertising and promotion.
perturbation.law_citation: 15 U.S. Code § 1114 - Remedies; infringement; innocent infringement by printers and publishers
perturbation.law_explanation: The Lanham Act protects trademark holders' rights to use their marks (including likeness as part of endorsement) in commerce to advertise and sell goods. By restricting the use of likeness to internal marketing, the modified text weakens the endorsement's commercial value, potentially infringing on Adams Golf's reasonable expectation of benefit, creating ambiguity and enforceability issues under trademark law.

perturbation.original_text: 5. EXCLUSIVE USE OF PRODUCT During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT. (It is expressly understood by the parties that CONSULTANT may play [* ****] clubs in the bag other than ADAMS GOLF clubs including, but not limited to, a putter by a manufacturer other than ADAMS GOLF but may not endorse those clubs and/or putter.)
perturbation.changed_text: 5. EXCLUSIVE USE OF PRODUCT During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT. (It is expressly understood by the parties that CONSULTANT may play clubs in the bag other than ADAMS GOLF clubs including, but not limited to, a putter by a manufacturer other than ADAMS GOLF and may, with express written consent from Adams Golf, endorse those clubs and/or putter.)
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly prohibits the consultant from endorsing non-Adams Golf clubs/putters. The modified text allows such endorsement with Adams Golf's written consent. This introduces a contradiction regarding the exclusivity of the endorsement agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
perturbation.law_explanation: While facially this modification adds 'flexibility' the insertion of 'express written consent' gives Adams Golf unilateral power to void the 'exclusivity' clause. Under common law, every contract contains an implied duty of good faith and fair dealing. Adams Golf can use that written consent to its own advantage.
perturbation.scraped_snippet: good faith | Wex | US Law | LII / Legal Information Institute Please help us improve our site! × No thank you good faith Good faith is a broad term that’s used to encompass honest dealing. Depending on the exact setting, good faith may require an honest belief or purpose, faithful performance of duties , observance of fair dealing standards, or an absence of fraudulent intent . A fiduciary relationship creates a duty of good faith between the agent and the principal . The breach of this duty of good faith can lead to liability . Failure to act in good faith is known as bad faith and is generally considered to be a level of culpability greater than negligence . perturbation.original_text: During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT will conduct himself at all times with due regard to public morals and conventions. If the value of CONSULTANT'S ENDORSEMENT is materially reduced or impaired because CONSULTANT: A.committed or shall commit any public act that involves moral turpitude, B.commits or violates any material foreign, U.S., federal, or other applicable state or local law, C.commits any act which brings him into public disrepute, contempt, scandal or ridicule, or which insults or offends the community, D.makes any statements in derogation, in any material respect, of ADAMS GOLF or any of its affiliates or any of their respective PRODUCT or services and such statement is made to the general public or becomes a matter of public knowledge, then at any time after the occurrence of such act, thing or statement, ADAMS GOLF shall have the right, in addition to its other legal and equitable remedies, to immediately terminate this Agreement, by giving written notice to CONSULTANT.
perturbation.changed_text: During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT will conduct himself at all times with due regard to public morals and conventions. If the value of CONSULTANT'S ENDORSEMENT is materially reduced or impaired because CONSULTANT: A.committed or shall commit any public act that involves moral turpitude, B.commits or violates any foreign, U.S., federal, or other applicable state or local traffic law, C.commits any act which brings him into public disrepute, contempt, scandal or ridicule, or which insults or offends the community, D.makes any statements in derogation of ADAMS GOLF or any of its affiliates or any of their respective PRODUCT or services and such statement is made to the general public or becomes a matter of public knowledge, then at any time after the occurrence of such act, thing or statement, ADAMS GOLF shall have the right, in addition to its other legal and equitable remedies, to immediately terminate this Agreement, by giving written notice to CONSULTANT.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides broad grounds for termination based on the consultant's conduct. By replacing 'any material foreign, U.S., federal, or other applicable state or local law' with 'any foreign, U.S., federal, or other applicable state or local traffic law', the modified text significantly narrows the grounds for termination. This creates a contradiction because the original intent was to protect Adams Golf's reputation from a wide range of misconduct, which the altered text no longer accomplishes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Doctrine of Frustration of Purpose
perturbation.law_explanation: The doctrine of frustration of purpose allows a party to be excused from performance if the principal purpose of the contract is substantially frustrated by an event, the non-occurrence of which was a basic assumption on which the contract was made. The original clause was intended to protect Adams Golf's brand image. By narrowing the termination clause to only traffic violations, Adams Golf is exposed to risks, undermining the contract's original intent.
perturbation.scraped_snippet: frustration of purpose | Wex | US Law | LII / Legal Information Institute Please help us improve our site! × No thank you frustration of purpose “Frustration of purpose” is a common law doctrine . Under contract law, an excuse can be used by a buyer for non-performance of contractual duties when a later and unforeseen event impedes the buyer's purpose for entering into the contract, and the seller at the time of entering the contract knew of the buyer's purpose. For example, if the parties enter into a futures contract for grain, but a fire causes the seller to have no crop that year and is unable to perform the contract, the buyer can use the frustration of purpose to excuse performance.
